data.title: Viktor Bolkhovitinov, aircraft designer C016 / 2687
data.meta_description: Prints of Victor Fedorovich Bolkhovitinov (1899-1970), Soviet aircraft designer. Our beautiful Wall Art and Photo Gifts include Framed Prints
data.text:
Victor Fedorovich Bolkhovitinov (1899-1970), Soviet aircraft designer. Bolkhovitinov, who reached the military rank of Major General, studied at the Zhukovsky Military-Aviation Engineering Academy near Moscow and worked there as a teacher and aircraft designer for most of his career. In the 1930s and 1940s he worked on aircraft design, forming his own design bureau for experimental aircraft called OKB-293. Designs included a large bomber and a rocket-powered interceptor, neither of which entered service. Photographed in Moscow, Russia, in 1965. Science Photo Library features Science and Medical images including photos and illustrations. Â© RIA NOVOSTI/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY

Media ID 9202435

Introducing the latest addition to our Media Storehouse Framed Prints collection: a captivating image of Soviet aircraft designer, Victor Fedorovich Bolkhovitinov (1899-1970). Reaching the distinguished military rank of Major General, Bolkhovitinov's innovative designs revolutionized aviation history. This striking photograph, taken by RIA Novosti/Science Photo Library, is now available as a beautifully framed print, adding an intriguing touch to any space. Embrace the rich history of aviation with this thought-provoking piece.
